result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miles L Clark

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Miles L Clark in court (in custody) with attorney Kyle Borkenhagen.  
Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights and enters no contest plea to Count 1 in 14CM436. 
Per ADA Isherwood, State has completed witness responsibilities. 
Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1 in 14CM436. 
15CM17 dismissed and read in. 
Court orders defendant to 10 days jail with defendant given credit for 13 days, therefore time served. 
Court orders costs of action to be paid by defendant. 
Defendant provided with notice of appeal rights.
Status conference on March 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Assistant District Attorney James Fassbender: Present
  Defendant present, in custody
  Attorney  Kyle Borkenhagen Present
  Complaint received.  Waive reading of complaint.
  Plea Not Guilty
  Signature Bond $1000
  Shall report immediately to Sheriff's Dept. for booking.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
STC, 03/16/15 @ 11:00 AM

Shall report immediately to Sheriff's Dept. for booking.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
